content: Sharon Osbourne made a rare appearance with her eldest daughter Aimee as they stepped out in London on Wednesday.

The TV personality, 70, cut a smart figure in a grey double breasted blazer as she walked with Aimee, 39.While her siblings Jack and Kelly have enjoyed successful media careers, singer Aimee has purposefully remained out of the reality TV spotlight that was cast upon the family during fly-on-the-wall show The Osbournes in the early noughties. She has instead focused on a career in acting music, with her debut album Vacare Adamaré - translated from Latin as To Be Free and Loved - released in 2020. Sharon opted for a pair of black wide legged trousers with a coordinated top for the outing.

The TV personality added inches to her frame in a pair of pointed toe boots and toted her belongings around in a large tote bag. The former X Factor judge rocked a large pair of chunky sunglasses and styled her signature red locks in chic short do. Aimee looked effortlessly stylish in a black blazer which she teamed with a pair of blue jeans and chunky lace up boots. She toted her belongings around in a dark backpack which boasted gold chain straps and carried a glass water bottle. Aimee styled her long brunette tresses in loose waves as they cascaded past her shoulders from under a black baseball cap.

She accessorised with a chic pearl choker and applied a flawless palette of makeup to accentuate her beauty. Sharon's arrival in the UK comes after she opened up about her struggle with continuous cosmetic surgery through the years.The music manager has revealed she has turned her back on cosmetic surgery after a 2021 facelift left her 'looking like a cyclops'.

The TV personality has been fond of going under the knife in the past but now has said the most recent procedure's results left her 'frightened'.She told The Sun: 'That [face life] put me off and it frightens me, I really f***ing pushed it with the last facelift and I am now like, no more'.'Time is against me, I cannot have another facelift.'She previously told The Sunday Times: 'I'm telling you, it was horrendous. [To the surgeon] I'm, like, "You've got to be f***** joking. 'One eye was different to the other. I looked like a f***** Cyclops. I'm, like, "All I need is a hunchback,"''It hurt like hell. You have no idea,' she added of the cosmetic surgery, which took five and a half hours.Her singer-songwriter husband Ozzy Osbourne, 74, apparently concurred that the results were not great and offered to pay to fix it.

'He said, "I don’t care how much it costs, we’ll get it redone,"' Sharon said.The TV personality has always been open about the procedures she's undergone over the years, and spoke about getting a face lift in 2019.She discussed the procedure in an October 2019 appearance on The Kelly Clarkson Show.'I had this thing where they lifted up my mouth and then for the first week I couldn’t feel my mouth, I can hardly feel my mouth now, to be honest with you,' she said.'I couldn’t find my mouth. It was numb and it was up on one side and I looked like Elvis. All the kids and Ozzy are going, "Why are you snarling at me?" And I’m like, "I’m not snarling; I’m not doing anything!"'
